description: Add comprehensive codebase audit, inventory, and evaluation feature to Ralph - enabling pre-development context, architecture gap detection, interactive Q&A refinement, and automatic PRD generation with prd.json conversion for immediate execution

userStories.title: Create audit module structure
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the audit module scaffolding so other audit features can be built on top of it.
acceptanceCriteria: Create src/audit/mod.rs with module organization and re-exports
Define core types: AuditReport, AuditFinding, FeatureOpportunity, Severity
userStories.notes: Foundation module - all other audit features depend on this

userStories.title: Implement file inventory scanner
userStories.description: As a user, I want the audit to scan the directory structure so I can see what files and folders exist in the codebase.
acceptanceCriteria: Identify key files (README, Cargo.toml, package.json, etc.)
userStories.notes: Use ignore crate for .gitignore support

userStories.title: Implement language detection
userStories.description: As a user, I want the audit to detect which programming languages are used so I understand the tech stack.
acceptanceCriteria: Return primary and secondary languages with percentages
Unit tests for each language detection
userStories.notes: Languages detected by manifest files and file extensions

userStories.title: Implement dependency parser
userStories.description: As a user, I want the audit to analyze dependencies so I can see what libraries the project uses.
acceptanceCriteria: Return DependencyAnalysis with direct and dev dependencies
Unit tests for each ecosystem parser
userStories.notes: Use toml and serde_json crates for parsing

userStories.title: Implement code pattern detection
userStories.description: As a user, I want the audit to detect code patterns and conventions so agents can follow existing practices.
userStories.notes: Use regex for pattern matching in source files

userStories.title: Implement architecture analysis
userStories.description: As a user, I want the audit to identify the architecture pattern so I understand how the codebase is organized.
acceptanceCriteria: Detect architecture patterns (layered, modular, hexagonal, clean, etc.)
userStories.notes: Analyze directory structure and import patterns

userStories.title: Implement API inventory
userStories.description: As a user, I want the audit to discover API endpoints and interfaces so I know what the codebase exposes.
acceptanceCriteria: Detect HTTP endpoints (axum, actix, express patterns)
Return ApiAnalysis with endpoints, commands, tools
userStories.notes: Use regex to find route definitions and clap derives

userStories.title: Implement test coverage analysis
userStories.description: As a user, I want the audit to analyze test coverage so I know which areas lack tests.
acceptanceCriteria: Count test files and test functions
Identify untested modules (modules with no corresponding tests)
userStories.notes: Look for #[test] and #[cfg(test)] in Rust, test/spec files in JS

userStories.title: Implement documentation gap detection
userStories.description: As a user, I want the audit to find missing documentation so I know what needs to be documented.
acceptanceCriteria: Check for README presence and completeness
Detect missing doc comments on public items (Rust)
userStories.notes: Look for /// comments before pub items in Rust

userStories.title: Implement architecture gap detector
userStories.description: As a user, I want the audit to identify architecture gaps so I know what improvements are needed.
acceptanceCriteria: Detect layer violations (e.g., UI calling DB directly)
Return list of AuditFinding with recommendations
userStories.notes: Analyze import patterns to detect violations

userStories.title: Implement opportunity detector
userStories.description: As a user, I want the audit to suggest complementary features so I know what could be added.
acceptanceCriteria: Define opportunity patterns (e.g., has quality gates but no audit command)
Return list of FeatureOpportunity with suggested stories
userStories.notes: Pattern matching based on what exists vs what could exist

userStories.title: Implement technical debt detector
userStories.description: As a user, I want the audit to find technical debt so I can prioritize cleanup.
acceptanceCriteria: Return list of AuditFinding for tech debt items
userStories.notes: Use regex to find TODO comments, compare dep versions

userStories.title: Implement JSON report output
userStories.description: As a user, I want audit results in JSON format so tools can consume them programmatically.
acceptanceCriteria: Include all sections: metadata, inventory, dependencies, findings, opportunities
userStories.notes: Use serde_json for serialization

userStories.title: Implement markdown report output
userStories.description: As a user, I want audit results in markdown format so I can read them easily.
acceptanceCriteria: Generate executive summary with key metrics
userStories.notes: Generate GitHub-flavored markdown

userStories.title: Implement agent context output
userStories.description: As a developer, I want audit patterns written to progress.txt so agents can follow existing conventions.
acceptanceCriteria: Generate Codebase Patterns section for progress.txt
Include naming conventions, architecture pattern, key conventions
userStories.notes: Format matches existing progress.txt pattern

userStories.title: Add audit CLI subcommand
userStories.description: As a user, I want to run ralph audit from the command line so I can audit any codebase.
acceptanceCriteria: Add Audit variant to Commands enum in src/main.rs
Support -f, --format for output format (json, markdown, context, all)
userStories.notes: Follow existing Commands pattern in main.rs

userStories.title: Implement interactive Q&A flow
userStories.description: As a user, I want the audit to ask me clarifying questions so it better understands my goals.
acceptanceCriteria: Questions include: project purpose, priorities, target users
In --smart mode, only ask when confidence < threshold
userStories.notes: Use console crate for terminal input

userStories.title: Implement audit-to-PRD generation
userStories.description: As a user, I want to generate a PRD from audit findings so I can start improving the codebase.
acceptanceCriteria: Generate PRD markdown following existing /prd skill format
userStories.notes: Follow PRD format from skills/prd/SKILL.md

userStories.title: Implement PRD-to-prd.json conversion
userStories.description: As a user, I want the audit to convert the generated PRD to prd.json so I can run ralph immediately.
acceptanceCriteria: Extract user stories and acceptance criteria
Generate valid prd.json with project, branchName, userStories
Set all stories to passes: false
Save to prd.json in working directory
userStories.notes: Follow prd.json format from skills/ralph/SKILL.md

userStories.title: Create /audit skill for Claude Code
userStories.description: As a user, I want to type /audit in Claude Code so I can run an interactive audit.
acceptanceCriteria: Create skills/audit/SKILL.md with full skill instructions
Define interactive Q&A flow matching CLI behavior
Include instructions for converting to prd.json
Skill follows existing /prd and /ralph skill patterns
userStories.notes: Reference skills/prd/SKILL.md and skills/ralph/SKILL.md as templates

userStories.title: Implement start_audit MCP tool
userStories.description: As an AI agent, I want to start an audit via MCP so I can analyze codebases programmatically.
acceptanceCriteria: Accept path parameter (optional, defaults to PRD directory)
Accept sections parameter to limit analysis scope
Accept format parameter for output format
Return audit ID for status checking
userStories.notes: Follow pattern from existing MCP tools in src/mcp/tools/

userStories.title: Implement get_audit_status MCP tool
userStories.description: As an AI agent, I want to check audit progress so I know when it's complete.
acceptanceCriteria: Return status: pending, running, completed, failed
userStories.notes: Status tracking similar to story execution state

userStories.title: Implement get_audit_results MCP tool
userStories.description: As an AI agent, I want to retrieve audit results so I can present findings to the user.
acceptanceCriteria: Return error if audit not complete
userStories.notes: Serialize AuditReport to JSON for MCP response

userStories.title: Implement generate_prd_from_audit MCP tool
userStories.description: As an AI agent, I want to generate a PRD from audit results so users can start improving their codebase.
acceptanceCriteria: Accept optional user answers from Q&A
userStories.notes: Reuse prd_generator and prd_converter modules

userStories.title: Add audit settings to quality profiles
userStories.description: As a user, I want to configure audit behavior via quality profiles so I can customize thresholds.
acceptanceCriteria: Add section toggles (structure, patterns, api, deps, tests, docs, arch)
Load audit config in quality profile loader
userStories.notes: Follow existing profile pattern in src/quality/profiles.rs

userStories.title: Integration test on Ralph's own codebase
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to run the audit on Ralph itself so I can verify it works end-to-end.
acceptanceCriteria: Create integration test that runs full audit on ralph codebase
Verify all analysis sections produce results
Verify JSON output is valid and parseable
Verify findings are reasonable for Ralph codebase
userStories.notes: Use tests/ directory for integration tests
